If a line has more than the specified number of characters, replaces the last white space character, such as a tab or space, preceding the specified position with a line break. If there are no white space characters, inserts a line break at the specified position. A common value for this attribute is 72.

parameter.name: charset
parameter.help:
The character encoding in which the part text is encoded.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

tag.name: cfmodule
tag.help: Invokes a custom tag for use in CFML application pages. This tag processes custom tag name conflicts.

parameter.name: template
parameter.help:
Mutually exclusive with the name attribute. A path to the page that implements the tag.
Relative path: expanded from the current page Absolute path: expanded using CFML mapping A physical path is not valid.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help:
Mutually exclusive with the template attribute. A custom tag name, in the form "Name.Name.Name..." Identifies subdirectory, under the CFML tag root directory, that contains custom tag page. For example (Windows format):
<cfmodule name = "superduper.Forums40.GetUserOptions">
This identifies the page GetUserOptions.cfm in the directory CustomTags\superduper\Forums40 under the CFML root directory.

parameter.name: attributecollection
parameter.help: A collection of key-value pairs that represent attribute names and values. You can specify multiple key-value pairs. You can specify this attribute only once.

tag.name: cfobject
tag.help:
Creates a CFML object, of a specified type.
The tag syntax depends on the object type. Some types use the type attribute; others do not.

tag.name: cfobjectcache
tag.help: Flushes the query cache.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: clear: Clears queries from the cache in the Application scope

tag.name: cfoutput
tag.help: Displays output that can contain the results of processing CFML variables and functions. Can loop over the results of a database query.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data for output section.

parameter.name: group
parameter.help: Query column to use to group sets of records. Eliminates adjacent duplicate rows when data is sorted. Use if you retrieved a record set ordered on one or more a query columns. For example, if a record set is ordered on "Customer_ID" in the cfquery tag, you can group the output on "Customer_ID."

parameter.name: groupcasesensitive
parameter.help: Whether to consider the case in grouping rows.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: Row from which to start output.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to display.

tag.name: cfparam
tag.help: Tests for a parameter's existence, tests its data type, and, if a default value is not assigned, optionally provides one.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of parameter to test (such as "client.email" or "cookie.backgroundColor"). If omitted, and if the parameter does not exist, an error is thrown.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: The valid format for the data; one of the following. * any: any type of value. * array: an array of values. * binary: a binary value. * boolean: a Boolean value: yes, no, true, false, or a number. * date or time: a date-time value. * guid: a Universally Unique Identifier of the form "XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXX" where 'X' is a hexadecimal number. * numeric: a numeric value * query: a query object. * string: a string value or single character. * struct: a structure. * UUID: a ColdFusion Universally Unique Identifier, formatted 'XXXXXXXX-XXXX-XXXX-XXXXXXXXXXXXXXX', where 'X' is a hexadecimal number. See CreateUUID. * variableName: a string formatted according to ColdFusion variable naming conventions.

parameter.name: default
parameter.help: Value to set parameter to if it does not exist. Any expression used for the default attribute is evaluated, even if the parameter exists. The result is not assigned if the parameter exists, but if the expression has side effects, they still occur.

tag.name: cfpop
tag.help: Retrieves or deletes e-mail messages from a POP mail server.

parameter.name: server
parameter.help: POP server identifier: A host name; for example, "biff.upperlip.com" An IP address; for example, "192.1.2.225"

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: POP port

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: getHeaderOnly: returns message header information only getAll: returns message header information, message text, and attachments if attachmentPath is specified delete: deletes messages on POP server

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for query object that contains the retrieved message information.

parameter.name: messagenumber
parameter.help: Message number or comma-delimited list of message numbers to get or delete. Invalid message numbers are ignored. Ignored if uid is specified.

parameter.name: uid
parameter.help: UID or a comma-delimited list of UIDs to get or delete. Invalid UIDs are ignored.

parameter.name: attachmentpath
parameter.help:
If action="getAll", specifies a directory in which to save any attachments. If the directory does not exist, CFML creates it.
If you omit this attribute, CFML does not save any attachments. If you specify a relative path, the path root is the CFML temporary directory, which is returned by the GetTempDirectory function.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help: Maximum time, in seconds, to wait for mail processing

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Number of messages to return or delete, starting with the number in startRow. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: First row number to get or delete. Ignored if messageNumber or uid is specified.

parameter.name: generateuniquefilenames
parameter.help: Yes: Generate unique filenames for files attached to an e-mail message, to avoid naming conflicts when files are saved

tag.name: cfprocessingdirective
tag.help:
Provides the following insformation to CFML on how to process the current page:
* Specifies whether to remove excess whitespace character from CFML generated content in the tag body. * Identifies the character encoding (character set) of the page contents.

parameter.name: suppresswhitespace
parameter.help: Boolean; whether to suppress white space characters within the cfprocessingdirective block that are generated by CFML tags and often do not affect HTML appearance. Does not affect any white space in HTML code.

parameter.name: pageencoding
parameter.help:
A string literal; cannot be a variable. Identifies the character encoding of the current CFML page. This attribute affects the entire page, not just the cfprocessing tag body. The value may be enclosed in single or double quotation marks, or none.
For more information on character encodings, see: www.w3.org/International/O-charset.html.

tag.name: cfprocparam
tag.help: Defines stored procedure parameters. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: in: The parameter is used to send data to the database system only. Passes the parameter by value. out: The parameter is used to receive data from the database system only. Passes the parameter as a bound variable. inout: The parameter is used to send and receive data. Passes the parameter as a bound variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: CFML variable name; references the value that the output parameter has after the stored procedure is called.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value that CFML passes to the stored procedure.

parameter.name: cfsqltype
parameter.help: SQL type to which the parameter (any type) is bound. CFML supports the following values, where the last element of the name corresponds to the SQL data type. Different database systems might support different subsets of this list. See your DBMS documentation for information on supported parameter types.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of a string or character IN or INOUT value attribute. A maxLength of 0 allows any length. The maxLength attribute is not required when specifying type=out.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Number of decimal places in numeric parameter. A scale of 0 allows any number of decimal places.

parameter.name: null
parameter.help: Whether the parameter is passed in as a null value. Not used with OUT type parameters.

tag.name: cfprocresult
tag.help: Associates a query object with a result set returned by a stored procedure. Other CFML tags, such as cfoutput and cftable, use this query object to access the result set. This tag is nested within a cfstoredproc tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the query result set.

parameter.name: resultset
parameter.help: Names one result set, if stored procedure returns more than one.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows returned in result set.

tag.name: cfproperty
tag.help: Defines properties of a CFML component (CFC). Used to create complex data types for web services. The attributes of this tag are exposed as component metadata and are subject to inheritance rules.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: A string; a property name. Must be a static value.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: A string; identifies the property data type

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Whether the parameter is required

parameter.name: default
parameter.help:
If no property value is set when the component is used for a web service, specifies a default value.
If this attribute is present, the required attribute must be set to "no" or not specified.

parameter.name: displayname
parameter.help: A value to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. The value appears in parentheses following the property name.

parameter.name: hint
parameter.help: Text to be displayed when using introspection to show information about the CFC. This attribute can be useful for describing the purpose of the parameter.

tag.name: cfquery
tag.help: Passes queries or SQL statements to a data source. It is recommended that you use the cfqueryparam tag within every cfquery tag, to help secure your databases from unauthorized users

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of query. Used in page to reference query record set. Must begin with a letter. Can include letters, numbers, and underscores.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of data source from which query gets data.

parameter.name: connectstring
parameter.help: Connection string for dynamic datasource. Only available on .NET

parameter.name: dbtype
parameter.help: query. Use this value to specify the results of a query as input dynamic. Use this to create a dynamic data source on .NET

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username in data source setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password in data source setup.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to return in record set. -1 returns all records.

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Maximum rows to get at a time from server. Range: 1 - 100. Might not be supported by some database systems.

parameter.name: timeout
parameter.help:
Maximum number of seconds that each action of a query is permitted to execute before returning an error. The cumulative time may exceed this value.
For JDBC statements, CFML sets this attribute. For other drivers, check driver documentation.

parameter.name: cachedafter
parameter.help:
Date value (for example, April 16, 1999, 4-16-99). If date of original query is after this date, CFML uses cached query data. To use cached data, current query must use same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, password.
A date/time object is in the range 100 AD-9999 AD.
When specifying a date value as a string, you must enclose it in quotation marks.

parameter.name: cachedwithin
parameter.help:
Timespan, using the CreateTimeSpan function. If original query date falls within the time span, cached query data is used. CreateTimeSpan defines a period from the present, back. Takes effect only if query caching is enabled in the Administrator.
To use cached data, the current query must use the same SQL statement, data source, query name, user name, and password.

parameter.name: cacheduntilchange
parameter.help: Only supported on .NET with SQL Server 2005.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled, but the Administrator Database Activity option is not enabled, displays SQL submitted to datasource and number of records returned by query. No: If the Administrator Database Activity option is enabled, suppresses display.

parameter.name: cachename
parameter.help: Name for cached query to facilitate easier purging.

tag.name: cfqueryparam
tag.help:
Verifies the data type of a query parameter and, for DBMSs that support bind variables, enables CFML to use bind variables in the SQL statement. Bind variable usage enhances performance when executing a cfquery statement multiple times.
This tag is nested within a cfquery tag, embedded in a query SQL statement. If you specify optional parameters, this tag performs data validation.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help:
Value that CFML passes to the right of the comparison operator in a where clause.
If CFSQLType is a date or time option, ensure that the date value uses your DBMS-specific date format. Use the CreateODBCDateTime or DateFormat and TimeFormat functions to format the date value.

parameter.name: cfsqltype
parameter.help: SQL type that parameter (any type) is bound to.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: Maximum length of parameter.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Number of decimal places in parameter. Applies to CF_SQL_NUMERIC and CF_SQL_DECIMAL.

parameter.name: null
parameter.help:
Whether parameter is passed as a null value.
Yes: tag ignores the value attribute No: does not

parameter.name: list
parameter.help: Yes: The value attribute value is a delimited list No: it is not

parameter.name: separator
parameter.help: Character that separates values in list, in value attribute.

tag.name: cfregistry
tag.help: Reads, writes, and deletes keys and values in the system registry. Provides persistent storage of client variables. Deprecated for the UNIX platform. Note: For this tag to execute, it must be enabled in the ColdFusion MX Administrator.

parameter.name: branch
parameter.help: Name of a registry branch.

parameter.name: entry
parameter.help: Registry value to access. Note: For key deletion this attribute is required.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable into which to put value.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * string: returns string values. * dWord: returns DWord values. * key: returns keys. * any: returns keys and values.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of record set to contain returned keys and values.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Sorts query column data (case-insensitive). Sorts on Entry, Type, and Value columns as text. Specify a combination of columns from query output, in a comma-delimited list. For example: sort = "value desc, entry asc" * asc: ascending (a to z) sort order. * desc: descending (z to a) sort order.

parameter.name: directory
parameter.help: Absolute pathname of directory against which to perform action.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for output record set.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.help: File extension filter applied to returned names. For example: *.cfm. One filter can be applied.

parameter.name: mode
parameter.help: Applies only to UNIX and Linux. Permissions. Octal values of Unix chmod command. Assigned to owner, group, and other, respectively.

parameter.name: sort
parameter.help: Query column(s) by which to sort directory listing. Delimited list of columns from query output.

parameter.name: newdirectory
parameter.help: New name for directory.

parameter.name: recurse
parameter.help: Whether ColdFusion performs the action on subdirectories.

tag.name: cfrethrow
tag.help: Rethrows the currently active exception. Preserves the exception's cfcatch.type and cfcatch.tagContext variable values.

tag.name: cfreturn
tag.help: Returns result values from a component method. Contains an expression returned as result of the function. An expression; the result of the function from which this tag is called.

tag.name: cfsavecontent
tag.help: Saves the generated content of the cfsavecontent tag, including the results of evaluating expressions and executing custom tags, in the specified variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name ofthe variable in which to save the generated content of the tag.

tag.name: cfschedule
tag.help: Provides a programmatic interface to the CFML scheduling engine. Can run a CFML page at scheduled intervals, with the option to write the page output to a static HTML page. This feature enables you to schedule pages that publish data, such as reports, without waiting while a database transaction is performed to populate the page.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: delete: deletes the specified task update: updates an existing task or creates a new task, if one with the name specified by the task attribute does not exist run: executes the specified task

parameter.name: task
parameter.help: Name of the task.

parameter.name: operation
parameter.help: Operation that the scheduler performs. Must be HTTPRequest.

parameter.name: file
parameter.help: Name of the file in which to store the published output of the scheuled task

parameter.name: path
parameter.help: Path to the directory in which to put the published file.

parameter.name: startdate
parameter.help: Date on which to first run the scheuled task.

parameter.name: starttime
parameter.help: Time at which to run the scheduled of task starts.

parameter.name: URL
parameter.help: URL of the page to execute.

parameter.name: port
parameter.help: Port to use on the server that is specified by the url parameter. If resolveURL = "yes", retrieved document URLs that specify a port number are automatically resolved, to preserve links in the retrieved document. A port value in the url attribute overrides this value.

parameter.name: publish
parameter.help: Yes: save the result to a file No: does not

parameter.name: enddate
parameter.help: Date when scheduled task ends.

parameter.name: endtime
parameter.help: Time when scheduled task ends (seconds).

parameter.name: interval
parameter.help: Interval at which task is scheduled. * number of seconds (minimum is 60) * once * daily * weekly * monthly

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Can be used to extend the default timeout period.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Username, if URL is protected.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Password, if URL is protected.

parameter.name: proxyserver
parameter.help: Host name or IP address of a proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyport
parameter.help: Port number to use on the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxyuser
parameter.help: User name to provide to the proxy server.

parameter.name: proxypassword
parameter.help: Password to provide to the proxy server.

parameter.name: resolveurl
parameter.help: Yes: resolve links in the output page to absolute references No: does not

tag.name: cfscript
tag.help:
Encloses a code block that contains cfscript statements.
You cannot use some CFML reserved words in this tag. You cannot put a user-defined function whose name begins with any of these strings within this tag: cf,cf_,_cf,CFML,CFML_,_CFML

tag.name: cfsearch
tag.help:
Searches Verity collections using CFML or K2Server, whichever search engine a collection is registered by. (CFML can also search collections that have not been registered, with the cfcollection tag.)
A collection must be created and indexed before this tag can return search results.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the search query.

parameter.name: collection
parameter.help:
One or more path(s) and/or registered collection name(s). For a registered collection, specify the collection name. For an unregistered collection, specify an absolute path. Registered names are listed in the CFML Administrator, Verity Collections and Verity Server pages.
To specify multiple collections, use a comma delimiter. For example: "CFUSER, e:\collections\personnel"
If you specify multiple collections, you cannot include a combination of collections that are registered by K2Server and registered by Verity.

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: simple: STEM and MANY operators are implicitly used. See Using Verity Search Expressions in Developing CFML MX Applications. explicit: operators must be invoked explicitly

parameter.name: criteria
parameter.help: Search criteria. Follows the syntax rules of the type attribute. If you pass a mixed-case entry in this attribute, the search is case-sensitive. If you pass all uppercase or all lowercase, the search is case-insensitive. Follow Verity syntax and delimiter character rules; see Using Verity Search Expressions in Developing CFML MX Applications.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to return in query results. Default: all

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: First row number to get. Default: 1

parameter.name: minscore
parameter.help: A number between 0 and 1.0. Only results with a score greater than this value will be returned.

tag.name: cfselect
tag.help:
Constructs a drop-down list box form control. Used within a cfform tag.
You can populate the list from a query, or by using the HTML option tag.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name of the select form element

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Number of entries to display at one time. The default, 1, displays a drop-down list. Any other value displays a list box with size number of entries visible at one time.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: If true a list element must be selected when form is submitted. Note: This attribute has no effect if you omit the size attribute or set it to 1 because the browser always submits the displayed item. You can work around this issue format forms by having an initial option tag with value=" " (note the space character between the quotation marks). Default: false

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message to display if required="true" and no selection is made.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: multiple
parameter.help: - true: allow selecting multiple elements in drop-down list - false: don't allow selecting multiple elements Default: false

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of query to populate drop-down list.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Query column to use for the value of each list element. Used with query attribute.

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: Query column to use for the display label of each list element. Used with query attribute.

parameter.name: selected
parameter.help: One or more option values to preselect in the selection list. To specify multiple values, use a comma-delimited list. This attribute applies only if selection list items are generated from a query. The cfform preservedata attribute value can override this value.

parameter.name: passthrough
parameter.help:
Passes one or more arbitrary attribute-value pairs to the HTML code that is generated for the tag. You can use either of the following formats to include the quotation marks around the attribute value:
passthrough="ID=""myID""" passthrough='ID="myID"'
The second format, which surrounds all the attribute-value pairs to be passed through in single quotation marks is clearer, particularly when you pass multiple HTML attributes.

tag.name: cfset
tag.help: Sets a value in CFML. Used to create a variable, if it does not exist, and assign it a value. Also used to call functions.

tag.name: cfsetting
tag.help: Controls aspects of page processing, such as the output of HTML code in pages.

parameter.name: enablecfoutputonly
parameter.help: Yes: blocks output of HTML that is outside cfoutput tags No: displays HTML that is outside cfoutput tags.

parameter.name: showdebugoutput
parameter.help: Yes: If debugging is enabled in the Administrator, displays debugging information No: suppresses debugging information that would otherwise display at end of generated page.

parameter.name: requesttimeout
parameter.help: Integer; number of seconds. Time limit, after which CFML processes the page as an unresponsive thread. Overrides the timeout set in the CFML Administrator.

tag.name: cfsilent
tag.help: Suppresses output produced by CFML within a tag's scope.

tag.name: cfslider
tag.help: Puts a slider control, for selecting a numeric value from a range, in a ColdFusion form. The slider moves over the slider groove. As the user moves the slider, the current value displays. Used within a cfform tag. Not supported with Flash forms.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for cfslider control.

parameter.name: label
parameter.help: Label to display with control. For example, "Volume" This displays: "Volume %value%" To reference the value, use "%value%". If %% is omitted, slider value displays directly after label.

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Numeric slider range values. Separate values with a comma.

parameter.name: scale
parameter.help: Unsigned integer. Defines slider scale, within range. For example: if range = "0,1000" and scale = "100", the display values are: 0, 100, 200, 300, ... Signed and unsigned integers in ColdFusion are in the range -2,147,483,648 to 2,147,483,647.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Starting slider setting. Must be within the range values.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input; in this case, a change to the default slider value. Specify only the function name.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to appear if validation fails.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails. Specify only the function name.

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Slider control height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Slider control width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical spacing above and below slider, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of slider, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment of slider: * top * left * bottom * baseline * texttop * absbottom * middle * absmiddle * right

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows

parameter.name: vertical
parameter.help: Yes: Renders slider in browser vertically. You must set width and height attributes; ColdFusion does not automatically swap width and height values. No: Renders slider horizontally.

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in italics No: it does not

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in bold No: it does not

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cfstoredproc
tag.help: Executes a stored procedure in a server database. It specifies database connection information and identifies the stored procedure.

parameter.name: procedure
parameter.help: Name of stored procedure on database server.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of data source that points to database that contains stored procedure.

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username in data source setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password in data source setup.

parameter.name: blockfactor
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to get at a time from server. Range is 1 to 100.

parameter.name: dbtpye
parameter.help: dynamic. Use this to create dynamic datasources on .NET

parameter.name: connectstring
parameter.help: The connection string for a dynamic datasource on .NET

parameter.name: debug
parameter.help: Yes: Lists debug information on each statement No: does not

parameter.name: returncode
parameter.help: Yes: Tag populates cfstoredproc.statusCode with status code returned by stored procedure. No: does not

tag.name: cfswitch
tag.help: Evaluates a passed expression and passes control to the cfcase tag that matches the expression result. You can, optionally, code a cfdefaultcase tag, which receives control if there is no matching cfcase tag value.

parameter.name: expression
parameter.help: CFML expression that yields a scalar value. CFML converts integers, real numbers, Booleans, and dates to numeric values. For example, True, 1, and 1.0 are all equal.

tag.name: cftable
tag.help:
Builds a table in a CFML page. This tag renders data as preformatted text, or, with the HTMLTable attribute, in an HTML table. If you do not want to write HTML table tag code, or if your data can be presented as preformatted text, use this tag. Preformatted text (defined in HTML with the 
 and
tags) displays text in a fixed-width font. It displays white space and line breaks exactly as they are written within the pre tags. For more information, see an HTML reference guide. To define table column and row characteristics, use the cfcol tag within this tag.

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Name of cfquery from which to draw data.

parameter.name: maxrows
parameter.help: Maximum number of rows to display in the table.

parameter.name: colspacing
parameter.help: Number of spaces between columns

parameter.name: headerlines
parameter.help: Number of lines to use for table header (the default leaves one line between header and first row of table).

parameter.name: htmltable
parameter.help:
Renders data in an HTML 3.0 table.
If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML renders data in an HTML table.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help:
Displays border around table.
If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML displays a border around the table.
Use this only if you use the HTMLTable attribute.

parameter.name: colheaders
parameter.help:
Displays column heads. If you use this attribute, you must also use the cfcol tag header attribute to define them.
If you use this attribute (regardless of its value), CFML displays column heads.

parameter.name: startrow
parameter.help: The query result row to put in the first table row.

tag.name: cftextinput
tag.help: Puts a single-line text entry box in a cfform tag and controls its display characteristics.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for the cftextinput control.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Initial value to display in text control.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: Yes: the user must enter or change text No

parameter.name: range
parameter.help: Minimum-maximum value range, delimited by a comma. Valid only for numeric data.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: date: verifies format mm/dd/yy. eurodate: verifies date format dd/mm/yyyy. time: verifies time format hh:mm:ss. float: verifies floating point format. integer: verifies integer format. telephone: verifies telephone format ###-###-####. The separator can be a blank. Area code and exchange must begin with digit 1 - 9. zipcode: verifies, in U.S. formats only, 5- or 9-digit format #####-####. The separator can be a blank. creditcard: strips blanks and dashes; verifies number using mod10 algorithm. Number must have 13-16 digits. social_security_number: verifies format ###-##-####. The separator can be a blank. regular_expression: matches input against pattern attribute.

parameter.name: onvalidate
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to validate user input. The form object, input object, and input object value are passed to routine, which should return True if validation succeeds, False otherwise. The validate attribute is ignored.

parameter.name: pattern
parameter.help: JavaScript regular expression pattern to validate input. Omit leading and trailing slashes

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message text to display if validation fails

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: Custom JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: size
parameter.help: Number of characters displayed before horizontal scroll bar displays.

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in italics No: it does not

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: Yes: displays tree control text in bold No: it does not

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Tree control height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Tree control width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: * top * left * bottom * baseline * texttop * absbottom * middle * absmiddle * right

parameter.name: bgcolor
parameter.help: Background color of control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: textcolor
parameter.help: Text color for control. For a hex value, use the form: textColor = "##xxxxxx", where x = 0-9 or A-F; use two hash signs or none.

parameter.name: maxlength
parameter.help: The maximum length of text entered.

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cfthrow
tag.help: Throws a developer-specified exception, which can be caught with a cfcatch tag that has any of the following type attribute options: type = "custom_type" type = "Application" type = "Any"

parameter.name: type
parameter.help: * A custom type * Application Do not enter another predefined type; types are not generated by CFML applications. If you specify Application, you need not specify a type for cfcatch.

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message that describes exception event.

parameter.name: detail
parameter.help: Description of the event. CFML appends error position to description; server uses this parameter if an error is not caught by your code.

parameter.name: errorcode
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: extendedinfo
parameter.help: A custom error code that you supply.

parameter.name: object
parameter.help:
Requires the value of the cfobject tag name attribute.
Throws a Java exception from a CFML tag.
This attribute is mutually exclusive with all other attributes of this tag.

tag.name: cftrace

parameter.name: abort
parameter.help: Calls cfabort tag when the tag is executed

parameter.name: category
parameter.help: User-defined string for identifying trace groups

parameter.name: inline
parameter.help: Displays trace code in line on the page in the location of the cftrace tag, addition to the debugging information output.

parameter.name: text
parameter.help: User-defined string, which can include simple variable, but not complex variables such as arrays. Outputs to cflog text attribute

parameter.name: type
parameter.help:
Corresponds to the cflog type attribute; displays an appropriate icon.
* Information * Warning * Error * Fatal Information

parameter.name: var
parameter.help:
The name of a simple or complex variable to display.
Useful for displaying a temporary value, or a value that does not display on any CFM page.

tag.name: cftransaction
tag.help: Instructs the database management system to treat multiple database operations as a single transaction. Provides database commit and rollback processing.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help:
• begin: the start of the block of code to execute
  • commit: commits a pending transaction
  • rollback: rolls back a pending transaction

parameter.name: isolation
parameter.help: ODBC lock type.

tag.name: cftree
tag.help: Inserts a tree control in a form. Validates user selections. Used within a cftree tag block. You can use a CFML query to supply data to the tree.

parameter.name: name
parameter.help: Name for tree control.

parameter.name: required
parameter.help: - true: user must select an item in tree control - false: they do not Default: false

parameter.name: appendkey
parameter.help: - true: if you use cftreeitem href attributes, ColdFusion appends a CFTREEITEMKEY query string variable with the value of the selected tree item to the cfform action URL. - false: do not append the tree item value to the URL. Default: true

parameter.name: highlighthref
parameter.help: - true: highlights as a link the displayed value for any cftreeitem tag that specifies a href attribute. - false: disables highlighting. Default: true

parameter.name: message
parameter.help: Message to display if validation fails.

parameter.name: onerror
parameter.help: JavaScript function to execute if validation fails.

parameter.name: lookandfeel
parameter.help: - motif: renders slider in Motif style - windows: renders slider in Windows style - metal: renders slider in Java Swing style If platform does not support style option, tag defaults to platform default style. Default: windows

parameter.name: font
parameter.help: Font name for data in tree control.

parameter.name: fontsize
parameter.help: Font size for text in tree control, in points.

parameter.name: italic
parameter.help: - true: displays tree control text in italics - false: it does not Default: false

parameter.name: bold
parameter.help: - true: displays tree control text in bold - false: it does not Default: false

parameter.name: height
parameter.help: Tree control height, in pixels.

parameter.name: width
parameter.help: Tree control width, in pixels.

parameter.name: vspace
parameter.help: Vertical margin above and below tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: hspace
parameter.help: Horizontal spacing to left and right of tree control, in pixels.

parameter.name: align
parameter.help: Alignment of the tree control applet object.

parameter.name: border
parameter.help: - true: display a border around the tree control. - false: no border Default: true

parameter.name: hscroll
parameter.help: - true: permits horizontal scrolling - false: no horizontal scrolling Default: true

parameter.name: vscroll
parameter.help: - true: permits vertical scrolling - false: no vertical scrolling Default: true

parameter.name: notsupported
parameter.help:
Text to display if a page that contains a Java applet-based cfform control is opened by a browser that does not support Java or has Java support disabled. Default: "Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!"

values.default:
Browser must support Java to
view ColdFusion Java Applets!

tag.name: cftreeitem
tag.help: Populates a form tree control, created with the cftree tag, with elements. To display icons, you can use the img values that CFML provides, or reference your own icons.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: Value passed when cfform is submitted. When populating a tree with data from a cfquery, specify columns in a delimited list. Example: value = "dept_id,emp_id"

parameter.name: display
parameter.help: Tree item label. When populating a tree with data from a query, specify names in a delimited list. Example: display = "dept_name,emp_name"

parameter.name: parent
parameter.help: Value for tree item parent.

parameter.name: href
parameter.help:
URL to associate with tree item or query column for a tree that is populated from a query. If href is a query column, its value is the value populated by query. If href is not recognized as a query column, it is assumed that its text is an HTML href.
When populating a tree with data from a query, HREFs can be specified in delimited list; for example:
href = "http://dept_svr,http://emp_svr"

parameter.name: target
parameter.help:
Target attribute of href URL. When populating a tree with data from a query, specify target in delimited list:
target = "FRAME_BODY,_blank"

parameter.name: query
parameter.help: Query name to generate data for the treeitem.

parameter.name: queryAsRoot
parameter.help:
Defines query as the root level. This avoids having to create another parent cftreeitem.
* Yes * No * String to use as the root name If you do not specify a root name, CFML returns the query name as the root.

parameter.name: expand
parameter.help: Yes: expands tree to show tree item children No: keeps tree item collapsed

tag.name: cftry
tag.help: Used with one or more cfcatch tags. Together, they catch and process exceptions in CFML pages. Exceptions are events that disrupt the normal flow of instructions in a CFML page, such as failed database operations, missing include files, and developer-specified events.

tag.name: cfupdate
tag.help: Updates records in a data source from data in a CFML form or form Scope.

parameter.name: datasource
parameter.help: Name of the data source that contains the table

parameter.name: dbtype
parameter.help: dynamic: Used with connectstring to create dynamic datasources on .NET

parameter.name: connectstring
parameter.help: The connection string for a dynamic datasource on .NET

parameter.name: tablename
parameter.help: Name of table to update. For ORACLE drivers, must be uppercase. For Sybase driver: case-sensitive; must be in same case as used when the table was created

parameter.name: tableowner
parameter.help: For data sources that support table ownership (for example, SQL Server, Oracle, Sybase SQL Anywhere), the table owner.

parameter.name: tablequalifier
parameter.help: For data sources that support table qualifiers. The purpose of table qualifiers is as follows: SQL Server and Oracle: name of database that contains table Intersolv dBASE driver: directory of DBF files

parameter.name: username
parameter.help: Overrides username value specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: password
parameter.help: Overrides password value specified in ODBC setup.

parameter.name: formfields
parameter.help:
Comma-delimited list of form fields to update.
If a form field is not matched by a column name in the database, CFML throws an error.
The formFields lies must include the database table primary key field, which must be present in the form. It can be hidden.

tag.name: cfwddx
tag.help:
Serializes and deserializes CFML data structures to the XML-based WDDX format. The WDDX is an XML vocabulary for describing complex data structures in a standard, generic way. Implementing it lets you use the HTTP protocol to such information among application server platforms, application servers, and browsers.
This tag generates JavaScript statements to instantiate JavaScript objects equivalent to the contents of a WDDX packet or CFML data structure. Interoperates with Unicode.

parameter.name: action
parameter.help: cfml2wddx: serialize CFML to WDDX wddx2cfml: deserialize WDDX to CFML cfml2js: serialize CFML to JavaScript wddx2js: deserialize WDDX to JavaScript

parameter.name: input
parameter.help: A value to process

parameter.name: output
parameter.help: Name of variable for output. If action = "WDDX2JS" or "CFML2JS", and this attribute is omitted, result is output in HTML stream.

parameter.name: toplevelvariable
parameter.help: Name of top-level JavaScript object created by deserialization. The object is an instance of the WddxRecordset object.

parameter.name: usetimezoneinfo
parameter.help: Whether to output time-zone information when serializing CFML to WDDX. - Yes: the hour-minute offset, represented in ISO8601 format, is output. - No: the local time is output.

parameter.name: validate
parameter.help: Applies if action = "wddx2cfml" or "wddx2js". - Yes: validates WDDX input with an XML parser using WDDX DTD. If parser processes input without error, packet is deserialized. Otherwise, an error is thrown. - No: no input validation

tag.name: cfxml
tag.help: Creates a CFML XML document object that contains the markup in the tag body. This tag can include XML and CFML tags. CFML processes the CFML code in the tag body, then assigns the resulting text to an XML document object variable.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Name of an xml variable

parameter.name: casesensitive
parameter.help: Maintains the case of document elements and attributes

function.name: assert
function.help: Asserts that the given expression is true.

function.name: getHttpContext
function.help: Returns the System.Web.HttpContext object associates with the request. Avaialble only on .NET

function.name: listRemoveDuplicates
function.help: Returns the list with the duplicates removed.

function.name: queryDeleteRow
function.help: Removes the given row from the given query

function.name: querySort
function.help: Sorts the given query on the given column with the given criteria

function.name: render
function.help: Executes the given string as CFML. Returns the output from the executed CFML.

function.name: abs
function.help: Absolute-value function. The absolute value of a number is the number without its sign.

function.name: acos
function.help: Returns the angle whose cosine is the value passed as the argument.

parameter.name: number
parameter.help: The value to be converted into an angle. Must be between -1 and 1.

function.name: arrayappend
function.help: Appends an array element to an array.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: The array to which the element should be appended.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The element to append. Can be any type.

function.name: arrayavg
function.help: Calculates the average of the values in an array. All elements in the array must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric.

function.name: arrayclear
function.help: Removes all elements from an array.

function.name: arraydeleteat
function.help: Deletes an element from an array and resizes the array so that the deleted element doesn't leave a gap.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: The array that the element will be deleted from.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The numeric position of the element. Remember that ColdFusion arrays start at 1 not 0.

function.name: arrayinsertat
function.help: Inserts a value at the specified position in the array. If the element is inserted before the end of the array, ColdFusion shifts the positions of all elements with a higher index to make room.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: The array which will have the new element inserted.

parameter.name: position
parameter.help: The numerical index in the array where the new element will be inserted. Must be less than or equal to the length of the array. Remember ColdFusion arrays start at 1 not 0.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: The new element to insert.

function.name: arrayisempty
function.help: Determines whether an array is empty. Equivalent to arrayLen(). Calling this function on an array with 10 undefined elements will return false. CFML MX: this function can be used on XML objects.

function.name: arraylen
function.help: Determines the number of elements in an array. CFML MX: this function can be used on child XML objects.

function.name: arraymax
function.help: Returns the largest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

function.name: arraymin
function.help: Returns the smallest numeric value in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero. All elements must contain values that can be automatically converted to numeric values.

function.name: arraynew
function.help: Creates an array of 1-3 dimensions. Index array elements with square brackets: [ ]. CFML arrays expand dynamically as data is added.

function.name: arrayprepend
function.help: Inserts an array element at the beginning of an array and shifts the positions of the existing elements to make room.

function.name: arrayresize
function.help: Resets an array to a specified minimum number of elements. This can improve performance, if used to size an array to its expected maximum. For more than 500 elements, use ArrayResize immediately after using the ArrayNew tag.

function.name: arrayset
function.help: In a one-dimensional array, sets the elements in a specified index range to a value. Useful for initializing an array after a call to ArrayNew.

function.name: arraysort
function.help: Sorts array elements numerically or alphanumerically.

parameter.name: array
parameter.help: Name of an array

parameter.name: sort_type
parameter.help:
numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account (also known as case sensitive). All letters of one case precede the first letter of the other case: - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" (ascending sort) - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" (descending sort)
textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case (also known as case-insensitive). A letter in varying cases precedes the next letter: - aAaBbBzzZ, in an ascending sort; preserves original intra-letter order - ZzzBbBaAa, in a descending sort; reverses original intra-letter order

parameter.name: sort_order
parameter.help:
asc: ascending sort order. Default. - aabzABZ or aAaBbBzzZ, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from smaller to larger, for numbers
desc: descending sort order. - ZBAzbaa or ZzzBbBaAa, depending on value of sort_type, for letters - from larger to smaller, for numbers

function.name: arraysum
function.help: The sum of values in an array. If the array parameter value is an empty array, returns zero.

function.name: arrayswap
function.help: Swaps array values of an array at specified positions. This function is more efficient than multiple cfset tags

function.name: arraytolist
function.help: Converts a one-dimensional array to a list.

function.name: asc
function.help: Determines the value of a character.

function.name: asin
function.help: Determines the arcsine of a number. The arcsine is the angle whose sine is number.

function.name: atn
function.help: Arctangent function. The arctangent is the angle whose tangent is number.

function.name: bitand
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical AND operation.

function.name: bitmaskclear
function.help: Performs a bitwise mask clear operation.

function.name: bitmaskread
function.help: Performs a bitwise mask read operation. Returns an integer, created from length bits of number, beginning at start.

function.name: bitmaskset
function.help: Performs a bitwise mask set operation.

function.name: bitnot
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical NOT operation.

function.name: bitor
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical OR operation.

function.name: bitshln
function.help: Performs a bitwise shift-left, no-rotation operation.

function.name: bitshrn
function.help: Performs a bitwise shift-right, no-rotation operation.

function.name: bitxor
function.help: Performs a bitwise logical XOR operation.

function.name: ceiling
function.help: Determines the closest integer that is greater than a specified number.

function.name: chr
function.help: Converts a numeric value to a UCS-2 character.

function.name: cjustify
function.help: Centers a string in a field length.

function.name: compare
function.help: Performs a case-sensitive comparison of two strings. -1, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 1, if string1 is greater than string2

function.name: comparenocase
function.help: Performs a case-insensitive comparison of two strings. An indicator of the difference: A negative number, if string1 is less than string2 0, if string1 is equal to string2 A positive number, if string1 is greater than string2

function.name: cos
function.help: Calculates the cosine of an angle that is entered in radians. A number; the cosine of the angle.

function.name: createdate
function.help: Creates a date/time object

function.name: createdatetime
function.help: Creates a date-time object.

function.name: createobject
function.help:
The CreateObject function takes different arguments depending on the value of the first argument:
CreateObject('com', class, context, serverName) CreateObject('component', component-name) CreateObject('corba', context, class, locale) CreateObject('java', class) CreateObject('webservice', urltowsdl) CreateObject('.net', class)

parameter.name: urltowsdl
parameter.help: WSDL file URL; location of web service

function.name: createodbcdate
function.help: Creates an ODBC date object.

function.name: createodbcdatetime
function.help: Creates an ODBC date-time object.

function.name: createodbctime
function.help: Creates an ODBC time object.

function.name: createtime
function.help: Creates a time variable.

function.name: createtimespan
function.help: Creates a date/time object that defines a time period. You can add or subtract it from other date/time objects and use it with the cachedWithin attribute of cfquery.

function.name: createuuid
function.help: Creates a Universally Unique Identifier (UUID). A UUID is a 35-character string representation of a unique 128-bit integer xxxxxxxx-xxxx-xxxx-xxxxxxxxxxxxxxxx : x is a hexadecimal digit

function.name: dateadd
function.help: Adds units of time to a date. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: datecompare
function.help: Performs a full date/time comparison of two dates. -1, if date1 is less than date2 0, if date1 is equal to date2 1, if date1 is greater than date2 [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: dateconvert
function.help: Converts local time to Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), or UTC to local time. The function uses the daylight savings settings in the executing computer to compute daylight savings time, if required. [type - quicky] local2Utc: Converts local time to UTC time. utc2Local: Converts UTC time to local time

function.name: datediff
function.help: Determines the integer number of units by which date1 is less than date2. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: dateformat
function.help: Formats a date value using U.S. date formats. For international date support, use LSDateFormat. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

function.name: datepart
function.help: Extracts a part from a date value as a numeric. [datepart - quicky] yyyy: Year; q: Quarter; m: Month; y: Day of year; d: Day w: Weekday; ww: Week; h: Hour; n: Minute; s: Second; l: Millisecond

function.name: day
function.help: Determines the day of the month, in a date. The ordinal for the day of the month, ranging from 1 to 31.

function.name: dayofweek
function.help: Determines the day of the week, in a date.

function.name: dayofweekasstring
function.help: Determines the day of the week as a string from 1-7

function.name: dayofyear
function.help: Determines the day of the year, in a date.

function.name: daysinmonth
function.help: Determines the number of days in a month.

function.name: daysinyear
function.help: Determines the number of days in a year.

function.name: de
function.help: Postpones evaluation of a string as an expression, when it is passed as a parameter to the IIf or Evaluate functions. Escapes any double quotation marks in the parameter and wraps the result in double quotation marks.

function.name: decimalformat
function.help: Converts a number to a decimal-formatted string.

function.name: decrementvalue
function.help: Decrements the integer part of a number.

function.name: decrypt
function.help: Decrypts a string that is encrypted with the Encrypt function.

parameter.name: encrypted_string
parameter.help: String to decrypt.

parameter.name: key
parameter.help: String. Seed used to generate 32-bit encryption key. Can be any combination of any number of characters.

function.name: deleteclientvariable
function.help: Deletes a client variable. (To test for the existence of a variable, use IsDefined.)

function.name: directoryexists
function.help: Determines whether a directory exists.

function.name: dollarformat
function.help: Formats a string in U.S. format. (For other currencies, use LSCurrencyFormat or LSEuroCurrencyFormat.)

function.name: duplicate
function.help: Returns a clone, also known as a deep copy, of a variable or XML object. There is no reference to the original variable.

function.name: encrypt
function.help: Encrypts a string. Uses a symmetric key-based algorithm, in which the same key is used to encrypt and decrypt a string. The security of the encrypted string depends on maintaining the secrecy of the key. Uses an XOR-based algorithm that uses a pseudo-random 32-bit key, based on a seed passed by the user as a function parameter.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: String to encrypt.

parameter.name: seed
parameter.help: Seed used to generate 32-bit encryption key. Can be any combination of any number of characters.

function.name: evaluate
function.help: Evaluates one or more string expressions, dynamically, from left to right. (The results of an evaluation on the left can have meaning in an expression to the right.) Returns the result of evaluating the rightmost expression.

function.name: exp
function.help: Calculates the exponent whose base is e that represents number. The constant e equals 2.71828182845904, the base of the natural logarithm. This function is the inverse of Log, the natural logarithm of number.

function.name: expandpath
function.help: Creates an absolute, platform-appropriate path that is equivalent to the value of relative_path, appended to the base path. This function (despite its name) can accept an absolute or relative path in the relative_path attribute

function.name: fileexists
function.help: Determines whether a file exists

function.name: find
function.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: findnocase
function.help: Finds the first occurrence of a substring in a string, from a specified start position. If substring is not in string, returns zero. The search is case-insensitive.

function.name: findoneof
function.help: Finds the first occurrence of any one of a set of characters in a string, from a specified start position. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: firstdayofmonth
function.help: Determines the ordinal (day number, in the year) of the first day of the month in which a given date falls.

function.name: fix
function.help: Converts a real number to an integer.

function.name: formatbasen
function.help: String Converts number to a string, in the base specified by radix. For example: #FormatBaseN(1024,16)#

function.name: getauthuser
function.help: Gets the name of an authenticated user.

function.name: getbasetagdata
function.help: Used within a custom tag. Finds calling (ancestor) tag by name and accesses its data.

function.name: getbasetaglist
function.help: Gets ancestor tag names, starting with the parent tag.

function.name: getbasetemplatepath
function.help: Gets the absolute path of an application's base page.

function.name: getclientvariableslist
function.help: Finds the client variables to which a page has write access. Comma-delimited list of non-read-only client variables

function.name: getcurrenttemplatepath
function.help: Gets the absolute path of the page that calls this function.

function.name: getdirectoryfrompath
function.help: Extracts a directory from an absolute path. Returns the absolute path, without the filename.

function.name: getencoding
function.help: Returns the encoding (character set) of the Form or URL scope.

function.name: getfilefrompath
function.help: Extracts a filename from an absolute path.

function.name: getfunctionlist
function.help: Displays a list of the functions that are available in CFML.

function.name: gethttprequestdata
function.help: Makes HTTP request headers and body available to CFML pages. Useful for capturing SOAP request data, which can be delivered in an HTTP header.

function.name: gethttptimestring
function.help: Gets the current time, in the Universal Time code (UTC).

function.name: getlocale
function.help: Gets the current geographic/language locale value. To set the default display format of date, time, number, and currency values in a CFML application session, you use the SetLocale function.

function.name: getmetadata
function.help: Gets metadata (the methods, properties, and parameters of a component) associated with an object that is deployed on the CFML server.

function.name: getpagecontext
function.help: Gets the current CFML MX PageContext object that provides access to page attributes and configuration, request and response objects.

function.name: getprofilesections
function.help: Gets all the sections of an initialization file. An initialization file, as a struct whose format is as follows: - Each initialization file section name is a key in the struct - Each list of entries in a section of an initialization file is a value in the struct

function.name: getprofilestring
function.help: Gets an initialization file entry. An initialization file assigns values to configuration variables, also known as entries, that are set when the system boots, the operating system comes up, or an application starts. Returns the entry - if no value, returns an empty string.

function.name: gettempdirectory
function.help: Gets the path of the directory that CFML uses for temporary files. Before using this function in an application, test to determine the directory it returns under your account. Returns the absolute pathname of a directory, including a trailing slash.

function.name: gettempfile
function.help: Creates a temporary file in a directory whose name starts with (at most) the first three characters of prefix.

function.name: gettemplatepath
function.help:
This function is deprecated.
Use the GetBaseTemplatePath function instead.

function.name: gettickcount
function.help: Returns the current value of an internal millisecond timer.

function.name: gettimezoneinfo
function.help: Gets local time zone information for the computer on which it is called, relative to Universal Time Coordinated (UTC). UTC is the mean solar time of the meridian of Greenwich, England.

function.name: gettoken
function.help: Determines whether a token of the list in the delimiters parameter is present in a string. Returns the token found at position index of the string, as a string. If index is greater than the number of tokens in the string, returns an empty string.

function.name: hash
function.help: Converts a variable-length string to a 32-byte, hexadecimal string, using the MD5 algorithm. (It is not possible to convert the hash result back to the source string.) 32-byte, hexadecimal string

function.name: hour
function.help: Gets the current hour of the day. Ordinal value of the hour, in the range 0 - 23.

function.name: htmlcodeformat
function.help:
Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents and inserts 
 and
tags at the beginning and end of the string. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

function.name: htmleditformat
function.help: Replaces special characters in a string with their HTML-escaped equivalents. [version] HTML version to use. currently ignored. -1: The latest implementation of HTML 2.0: HTML 2.0 (Default) 3.2: HTML 3.2

function.name: iif
function.help: Evaluates a Boolean conditional dynamic expression. Depending on whether the expression is true or false, dynamically evaluates one of two string expressions and returns the result.

function.name: incrementvalue
function.help: Adds one to an integer. same as x=x+1 Why bother?

function.name: inputbasen
function.help: Converts string, using the base specified by radix, to an integer. For example: #InputBaseN("3ff",16)#

function.name: insert
function.help: Inserts a substring in a string after a specified character position. If position = 0, prefixes the substring to the string.

function.name: int
function.help: Calculates the closest integer that is smaller than number.

function.name: isarray
function.help: Determines whether a value is an array. True, if value is an array, a query column object, or xml. also number = Dimension; function tests whether the array has exactly this dimension

function.name: isbinary
function.help: Determines whether a value is stored as binary data.

function.name: isboolean
function.help: Determines whether a value can be converted to Boolean

function.name: iscustomfunction
function.help: Determines whether a name represents a custom function

function.name: isdate
function.help: Determines whether a string or Java object can be converted to a date/time value.

function.name: isdebugmode
function.help: Determines whether debugging output is enabled.

function.name: isdefined
function.help: Evaluates a string value to determine whether the variable named in it exists.

function.name: isleapyear
function.help: Determines whether a year is a leap year.

function.name: isnumeric
function.help: Determines whether a string can be converted to a numeric value. Supports numbers in U.S. number format. For other number support use LSIsNumeric.

function.name: isnumericdate
function.help: Evaluates whether a real number is a valid representation of a date (date/time object).

function.name: isobject
function.help: Determines whether a value is an object. True, if the value represents a CFML object. False if the value is any other type of data, such as an integer, string, date, or struct.

function.name: isquery
function.help: Determines whether value is a query.

function.name: issimplevalue
function.help: Determines the type of a value.

function.name: isstruct
function.help: Determines whether a variable is a structure. True, if variable is a CFML structure or is a Java object that implements the java.lang.Map interface. Returns False if the object in variable is a user-defined function (UDF).

function.name: isuserinrole
function.help: Determines whether an authenticated user belongs to the specified Role.

function.name: iswddx
function.help: Determines whether a value is a well-formed WDDX packet.

function.name: isxmldoc
function.help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

function.name: isxmlelem
function.help: Determines whether a function parameter is an Extended Markup language (XML) document object element.

function.name: isxmlroot
function.help: Determines whether a function parameter is the root element of an Extended Markup language (XML) document object.

function.name: javacast
function.help: Converts the data type of a CFML variable to pass as an argument to an overloaded method of a Java object. Use only for scalar and string arguments. [type - quicky] boolean,int,long,float,double,string

function.name: jsstringformat
function.help: Escapes special JavaScript characters, such as single quotation mark, double quotation mark, and newline

function.name: lcase
function.help: Converts the alphabetic characters in a string to lowercase.

function.name: left
function.help: Returns the leftmost count characters in a string.

function.name: len
function.help: Determines the length of a string or binary object

function.name: listappend
function.help: Concatenates a list or element to a list.

parameter.name: value
parameter.help: An element or a list of elements.

function.name: listchangedelims
function.help: Changes a list delimiter. Returns a copy of the list, with each delimiter character replaced by new_delimiter.

function.name: listcontains
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring. Returns the index of the first list element that contains substring. If not found, returns zero.

function.name: listcontainsnocase
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element that contains a specified substring.

function.name: listdeleteat
function.help: Deletes an element from a list. Returns a copy of the list, without the specified element.

function.name: listfind
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs. Case-sensitive

function.name: listfindnocase
function.help: Determines the index of the first list element in which a specified value occurs

function.name: listfirst
function.help: Gets the first element of a list.

function.name: listgetat
function.help: Gets a list element at a specified position.

function.name: listinsertat
function.help: Inserts an element in a list.

function.name: listlast
function.help: Gets the last element of a list.

function.name: listlen
function.help: Determines the number of elements in a list.

function.name: listprepend
function.help: Inserts an element at the beginning of a list.

function.name: listqualify
function.help: Inserts a string at the beginning and end of list elements.

function.name: listrest
function.help: Gets a list, without its first element.

function.name: listsetat
function.help: Replaces the contents of a list element.

function.name: listsort
function.help: Sorts list elements according to a sort type and sort order. Returns a sorted copy of the list. [sort_type - quicky] numeric: sorts numbers text: sorts text alphabetically, taking case into account - aabzABZ, if sort_order = "asc" - ZBAzbaa, if sort_order = "desc" textnocase: sorts text alphabetically, without regard to case - aAaBbBzzZ, in an asc sort; - ZzzBbBaAa, in a desc sort;

function.name: listtoarray
function.help: Copies the elements of a list to an array.

parameter.name: keepEmptyValues
parameter.help: Indicates whether or not to keep empty values. Defaults to false.

function.name: listvaluecount
function.help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-sensitive.

function.name: listvaluecountnocase
function.help: Counts instances of a specified value in a list. The search is case-insensitive.

function.name: ljustify
function.help: Left justifies characters in a string of a specified length.

function.name: log
function.help: Calculates the natural logarithm of a number. Natural logarithms are based on the constant e (2.71828182845904).

function.name: log10
function.help: Calculates the logarithm of number, to base 10.

function.name: lscurrencyformat
function.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. For countries that use the euro, the result depends on the JVM. [type - quicky] local: the currency format and currency symbol used locally. - With JDK 1.3, the default for Euro Zone: local currency. - With JDK 1.4, the default for Euro Zone: euro. international: the international standard currency format none: the local currency format; no currency symbol

function.name: lsdateformat
function.help: Formats the date part of a date/time value in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] d,dd,ddd,dddd: Day of month / week m,mm,mmm,mmmm: Month; y,yy,yyyy: Year; gg: Period/era string short / medium / long / full

function.name: lseurocurrencyformat
function.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific currency format. [type - quicky] local: the currency format used in the locale. (Default.) international: the international standard currency format none: the currency format used; no currency symbol

function.name: lsiscurrency
function.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a currency amount in the current locale.

function.name: lsisdate
function.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a date/time value in the current locale.

function.name: lsisnumeric
function.help: Determines whether a string is a valid representation of a number in the current locale.

function.name: lsnumberformat
function.help: Formats a number in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

function.name: lsparsecurrency
function.help: Converts a locale-specific currency string into a formatted number. Attempts conversion by comparing the string with each the three supported currency formats (none, local, international) and using the first that matches.

function.name: lsparsenumber
function.help: Converts a string that is a valid numeric representation in the current locale into a formatted number.

function.name: lstimeformat
function.help: Formats the time part of a date/time string into a string in a locale-specific format. [mask - quicky] h,hh,H,HH: Hours; m,mm: Minutes; s,ss: Seconds; l: Milliseconds; t: A or P; tt: AM or PM "short" = h:mm tt; "medium" = h:mm:ss tt

function.name: ltrim
function.help: Removes leading spaces from a string.

function.name: max
function.help: Determines the greater of two numbers.

function.name: mid
function.help: Extracts a substring from a string.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: The string from which the substring will be extracted.

parameter.name: start
parameter.help: The position of the first character to retrieve.

parameter.name: count
parameter.help: The number of characters to retrieve.

function.name: min
function.help: Determines the lesser of two numbers.

function.name: minute
function.help: Extracts the minute value from a date/time object.

function.name: month
function.help: Extracts the month value from a date/time object.

function.name: now
function.help: Gets the current date and time of the computer running the CFML server.

function.name: numberformat
function.help: Creates a custom-formatted number value. For international number formatting use LSNumberFormat. [mask - quicky] _,9 Digit placeholder; . decimal point; 0 Pads with zeros; ( ) less than zero, puts parentheses around the mask + plus sign before positive number minus before negative - a space before positive minus sign before negative , Separates every third decimal place with a comma. L,C Left-justifies or center-justifies number $ dollar sign before formatted number. ^ Separates left and right formatting.

function.name: paragraphformat
function.help:
Replaces characters in a string: * Single newline characters (CR/LF sequences) with spaces * Double newline characters with HTML paragraph tags (

)

function.name: parsedatetime
function.help: Parses a date/time string according to the English (U.S.) locale conventions. (To format a date/time string for other locales, use the LSParseDateTime function.)

parameter.name: pop_conversion
parameter.help: - standard: (the default) function does no conversion. - pop: specifies that the date/time string is in POP format, which includes the local time of the sender and a time-zone offset from UTC. ColdFusion applies the offset and returns a value with the UTC time.

function.name: pi
function.help: Gets the mathematical constant p, accurate to 15 digits. The number 3.14159265358979.

function.name: preservesinglequotes
function.help:
Prevents CFML from automatically escaping single quotation mark characters that are contained in a variable. CFML does not evaluate the argument.
Note: ColdFusion automatically escapes simple-variable, array-variable, and structure-variable references within a cfquery tag body or block.

parameter.name: variable
parameter.help: Variable that contains a string in which to preserve single quotation marks.

function.name: quarter
function.help: Calculates the quarter of the year in which a date falls.

function.name: queryaddcolumn
function.help: Adds a column to a query and populates its rows with the contents of a one-dimensional array. Pads query columns, if necessary, to ensure that all columns have the same number of rows.

function.name: queryaddrow
function.help: Adds a specified number of empty rows to a query.

function.name: querynew
function.help: Creates an empty query (query object).

parameter.name: columnlist
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. Delimited list of column names, or an empty string.

function.name: querysetcell
function.help: Sets a cell to a value. If no row number is specified, the cell on the last row is set.

function.name: quotedvaluelist
function.help: Gets the values of each record returned from an executed query. CFML does not evaluate the arguments

function.name: rand
function.help: Generates a pseudo-random number in the range 0 - 1.

function.name: randomize
function.help: Seeds the pseudo-random number generator with an integer number, ensuring repeatable number patterns.

function.name: randrange
function.help: Generates a random integer between two specified numbers. Requests for random integers that are greater than 100,000,000 result in non-random numbers, to prevent overflow during internal computations.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

parameter.name: returnsubexpressions
parameter.help: True: if the regular expression is found, the first array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first match. If the regular expression contains parentheses that group subexpressions, each subsequent array element contains the length and position, respectively, of the first occurrence of each group. If the regular expression is not found, the arrays each contain one element with the value 0. False: the function returns the position in the string where the match begins. Default.

function.name: refindnocase
function.help: Uses a regular expression (RE) to search a string for a pattern, starting from a specified position. The search is case-insensitive.

parameter.name: String
parameter.help: A string or a variable that contains one. String in which to search.

parameter.name: returnsubexpressions
